chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Dionte Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Carrying License. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/15/2016 along with other fine on 15CM2077. Payment plan fee to be added. Suspension of driver's license for 1 year as alternate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Steven Dionte Davis in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend charge to No License on Person contrary to section 343.18(1), Wisconsin Statutes.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Court orders the following:
$210.80 to be paid at the rate of $50/month commencing on 11/15/16; 1 year drivers license suspension as penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant Steven Dionte Davis in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse for attorney Hoff.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant to go to the business center to check on his payments for his attorney. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to complete his counseling. Court grants.
